"'Control'" is a song released by the post-grunge group Puddle of Mudd, as the
first single off of their album Come Clean. It was released in July 2001 (see
2001 in music), "Control" is about vanity, and was written by Wes Scantlin and
co-written by Brad Stewart formerly of Shinedown. The single was successful,
peaking at #3 on the Mainstream Rock Chart and #3 on Modern Rock Charts and peak
at #68 at the Billboard Hot 100 and brought Puddle of Mudd worldwide fame.
